metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0251 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The mod_dav_svn server in Subversion 1.5.0 through 1.7.19 and 1.8.0 through 1.8.11 allows remote authenticated users to spoof the svn:author property via a crafted v1 HTTP protocol request sequences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0251` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libapache2-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn-java - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn-perl - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn-ruby1.8 - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
libsvn1 - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
python-subversion - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
ruby-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
subversion - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
subversion-tools - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> libapache2-mod-svn (libapache2-svn in older releases) is a universe binary

criterions.comment: subversion package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.8-1ubuntu3.2').
